elements.text:
You just experienced a lot of chorea while out in public. You fear that everyone around you saw it and is now judging you.

Here are some feelings that might happen in the moment:

texts: I'm scared that this caused a huge scene and people will be talking about me negatively.
I'm happy that my movements did not cause me to break or hit anything around me.
I'm confident I won't let my social anxiety control me.
I'm anxious about what people might think about me, but I know that the only people's opinions who are valid are those who were worried about me.
I'm anxious if I look up that a lot of people will be staring at me, but I know if I go about my day as normal, they'll all forget about it quickly.
